alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 2:46PM CST until February 20 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river are flooded. Portions of Corinth Road, north of Danville, become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday afternoon to a crest of 20.3 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 17.7 Thu 1 PM 19.9 20.3 20.0 20.3 6 PM 2/17 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
